Description: Upper body sherd of South Ionian pottery little-master cup; interior: lip glazed, broad reserved zone below; lower wall glazed; exterior: lip and handle reserved with broad black band at top of handle zone; lower wall glazed; plastic knuckle bone, glazed, in handle zone; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Schlotzhauer Ionian Cup Type with application
Schlotzhauer little master Ionian Cup type
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as belonging to the South Ionian little master cup Type and South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9C. However, the curvature of the shoulder is consistent with his Type 9.B. For parallels regarding the shape and decoration, see See Berlin 3678 from Rhodes (Samos 6.1, pl.42 no. 346).
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 52, no. 287)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.764) (Phase 3)
